intro: Fagara pistaciiflora, commonly known as the glossy buckthorn, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers followed by dark blue or black berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Its ornamental value is appreciated in horticulture, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
